headline: Why Fair Isaac Stock Was Blasted Again on Wednesday
summary: A top government housing official specifically mentioned the company in a negative light in a post on X (formerly Twitter).  This followed critical remarks he made the previous day about the credit scoring and reporting businesses.  For the second trading session in a row, the credit scoring specialist took a real blow to its stock price, which tumbled by almost 16% on the day.

headline: S&P 500 Gains & Losses Today: Index Slips as Congress Mulls Tax Bill, Treasury Yields Surge
summary: The S&P 500 dropped 1.6% on Wednesday, May 21, 2025, as long-term Treasury yields pushed higher and Congressional budget talks spotlighted deficit concerns.

headline: RBC, Jefferies Back Fair Isaac Corp. (FICO) After Stock Declines
summary: RBC remains optimistic on Fair Isaac Corp. (NYSE:FICO) after the recent comments from Bill Pulte, Director of the Federal Housing Finance Agency (FHFA), led to selling pressure on the stock. In his note on May 20, an RBC analyst noted that while speaking at a Mortgage Bankers Association conference, the FHFA Director raised concerns about […]

headline: Credit Score Stocks Slide as FHFA Head Questions Pricing

headline: OpenAI-io Products, Fair Isaac criticism, Carter's dividend cut
summary: Yahoo Finance host Julie Hyman tracks today's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute, including OpenAI's bid to acquire former Apple (AAPL) executive Jony Ive's startup io Products, shares of Fair Isaac (FICO) taking a hit amid criticism on its credit report pricing, and children's clothing brand Carter's, Inc. (CRI) slashing its quarterly dividend. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Fair Isaac (NYSE:FICO) Powers Vitality's Digital Health Transformation With FICO Platform
summary: Fair Isaac (NYSE:FICO) experienced a 15% price increase in the last quarter, likely influenced by the recent collaborations with companies such as Vitality and Entercard, which highlighted advancements in personalized services and fraud detection. The integration of FICO's technology in Vitality's Care Hub and Entercard's fraud prevention strategy showcases the company's innovative capabilities. headline: Fair Isaac, Credit Score Stocks Dive As Agency Chief Targets Mortgage Costs
summary: Shares of Fair Isaac plunged for a second straight day while rival credit-score providers Equifax and TransUnion also slid after a top federal official targeted them in a bid to lower mortgage origination costs.  Federal Housing Finance Agency Director Bill Pulte, speaking at the Mortgage Bankers Association conference Tuesday, said the agency is looking to replace the "tri-merge" credit scores with a bi-merged score to reduce costs.  The proposal started with the Biden administration, and Pulte said the FHFA continues to support it.

raw.headline: Fair Isaac, Credit Score Stocks Dive As Agency Chief Targets Mortgage Costs

Federal Housing Finance Agency Director Bill Pulte, speaking at the Mortgage Bankers Association conference Tuesday, said the agency is looking to replace the "tri-merge" credit scores with a bi-merged score to reduce costs.  The proposal started with the Biden administration, and Pulte said the FHFA continues to support it.
